text: Hello everyone. New to CLI and Local dev for HubSpot so i have installed the extension for VS code and i have create a website theme with the boilerplate. So, i dont know why but i receive many errors about the paths of the files, though the paths are correct " i think ". So could you please help me to see whats wrong here?  Thank you all
Hi George did you setup your file.associations? <https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=HubSpot.hubl>
If you have done that make sure at the bottom that you choose the correct one.

Im not sure that this is an associations error. The hubl isnt getting flagged it’s the path of the file. So this looks like it’s a linting issue. I have noticed that the linter - which I think is still in test mode - doesnt grab local files very well. If you can push these changes to the portal and nothing gets flagged there I wouldnt worry about it. You can also turn the liniting off in the extension settings if you find it annoying.

Any way to show line numbers on CLI errors  from `hs watch` (complaining about fields.json changes)?

Being new to working with this fields.json file, this is very difficult to deal with.

`[ERROR] Uploading file C:\c\hs-templates\theme-21\fields.json to bastyr-21/bastyr-21/fields.json failed`
`[ERROR] internal error`
`[ERROR] The format for the color value is invalid`
`[ERROR] The format for the color value is invalid`
`[ERROR] The format for the color value is invalid`
I fixed the actual errors, but it would still be _really_ helpful to display line numbers for each error
welcome :slightly_smiling_face: I'm in a similar boat
